page.title: 04CHURCHES IN HAM
page.content: There are 6 churches in Ham. {St.Peter's}church is the oldest, 1200 years old. Captain Vancouver is buried in the graveyard. {St.Richard's}is the newest, built in 1966. It has a church school, which was built at the same time. The old church school of{St.Andrew's}moved to the new building and the old school has become{St.Thomas'}Catholic church. There is a convent in Ham,{ {St.Michael's,}where 30 nuns live.{ {St.Andrew's}church is 100 years old.{ {All Saints}church is now closed. There is a{chapel}in Lock Road,Ham. The present vicars in Ham are the Rev.T.Hazelgrove at St.Richard's and the Rev.J.Russell at St.Andrew's.
